question: Create a health-check route in Express that responds with JSON {status: 'ok'}.
correctness: GET /health returns 200 with JSON {status:'ok'}.

question: Create a semantic page structure with a navigation, main content, and footer for a blog index.
example_answer:
• Home
  • Posts

Recent Posts

...
© 2026 Example Blog
correctness: Uses semantic elements and ARIA landmarks for navigation and main content.

question: Write a function that reverses a Unicode-safe string in JavaScript.
example_answer: function reverseString(str) { return Array.from(str).reverse().join(''); }
correctness: Reverses characters correctly, including emoji and multi-byte characters.

question: Center a div both vertically and horizontally using modern CSS.
example_answer: .center { display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; height: 100vh; }
correctness: Flexbox centering works across modern browsers and centers content both axes.

question: Create a responsive two-column layout with a fixed 250px sidebar and flexible content area.
example_answer: .layout { display: grid; grid-template-columns: 250px 1fr; gap: 16px; } @media (max-width: 700px) { .layout { grid-template-columns: 1fr; } }
correctness: Sidebar remains fixed width on large screens and stacks on small screens.

question: Harden an Express app: add Helmet headers and a basic rate limiter.
correctness: App sets secure headers with Helmet and limits repeated requests.

question: Fix a header overlapping content when using position:fixed.
example_answer: If the header is fixed, add top padding to the body equal to the header height, e.g.: header{position:fixed;top:0;left:0;right:0;height:56px;} body{padding-top:56px;} Alternatively use CSS vars and calc() for dynamic sizing.
correctness: Adding equivalent top padding prevents fixed header from covering content.

question: Prevent SQL injection when selecting a user by email in a Node.js app.
example_answer: Use parameterized queries instead of string concatenation. Example with mysql2: connection.execute('SELECT id, name FROM users WHERE email = ?', [email]) .then(([rows]) => { /*...*/ });
correctness: Parameterized queries avoid injection by separating SQL and data.

question: Safely display user-provided text in React without allowing XSS.
example_answer:
Avoid dangerouslySetInnerHTML for untrusted content. Render text nodes directly:
{userInput}
. If HTML is required, sanitize on the server or with a vetted sanitizer before passing to the client.
correctness: Rendering text via JSX escapes characters and prevents XSS; sanitization required for HTML.

question: Best practices when debugging a function that throws intermittently in the browser.
example_answer: Use console.log to inspect inputs and add a 'debugger' statement to break into DevTools. Also enable source maps and add try/catch around suspect code to log stack traces. Example: try { fn(); } catch(e) { console.error('Error in fn', e); }
correctness: Using logs, breakpoints, and source maps helps locate intermittent errors.

question: Where should application secrets be stored and how accessed in Node.js?
example_answer: Store secrets in environment variables (or a secrets manager). Access via process.env.SOME_SECRET. In development you can use a .env file loaded by dotenv (not committed to VCS). Example: const apiKey = process.env.API_KEY || '';
correctness: Environment variables keep secrets out of the repository; production should use a secrets manager.

question: How to attach the Node.js inspector for debugging a running process.
example_answer: Start node with --inspect or --inspect-brk: node --inspect-brk index.js, then open chrome://inspect in Chrome to connect. You can also use VS Code's attach configuration to connect to the inspector port.
correctness: Using --inspect allows debuggers to connect to the Node process for breakpoints and inspection.

question: Perform a funds transfer between accounts atomically using transactions.
example_answer: START TRANSACTION; UPDATE accounts SET balance = balance - 100 WHERE id = 1; UPDATE accounts SET balance = balance + 100 WHERE id = 2; COMMIT; -- on error: ROLLBACK;
correctness: Using START TRANSACTION / COMMIT ensures both updates succeed or none do.

question: Create an accessible contact form with labels and required validation.
example_answer:
<form action="/contact" method="post">
  <label for="name">Name</label>
  <input id="name" name="name" required>
  <label for="email">Email</label>
  <input id="email" name="email" type="email" required>
  <button type="submit">Send</button>
</form>
correctness: Form uses labels and required attributes for accessibility and basic validation.

question: Query users created in the last 30 days.
example_answer: SELECT id, name, email FROM users WHERE created_at >= NOW() - INTERVAL 30 DAY;
correctness: Returns users whose created_at timestamp is within the last 30 days.

question: Improve accessibility by adding meaningful alt text to images.
correctness: Alt text describes the image for screen readers and when images fail to load.

question: Set secure cookie flags when sending a session cookie from the server.
example_answer: res.cookie('sid', token, { httpOnly: true, secure: true, sameSite: 'Strict' });
correctness: Using HttpOnly, Secure, and SameSite reduces risk of XSS and CSRF on cookies.

question: Make a flex container wrap long items onto multiple rows.
example_answer: .container{display:flex;flex-wrap:wrap;gap:12px;} .item{min-width:140px}
correctness: flex-wrap allows items to flow to new lines instead of overflowing.

question: Add an index to speed up queries filtering by created_at.
example_answer: CREATE INDEX idx_events_created_at ON events(created_at);
correctness: Indexing the timestamp column speeds time-based queries.

question: Write a simple unit test for an add(a,b) function using Node's assert.
example_answer: const assert = require('assert'); function add(a,b){return a+b;} assert.strictEqual(add(2,3),5); console.log('test passed');
correctness: Assertion verifies add(2,3) returns 5; test will throw if failing.

question: Use an environment variable for the server port with fallback.
example_answer: const port = process.env.PORT || 3000; app.listen(port, () => console.log(`Listening ${port}`));
correctness: Server reads PORT from environment and falls back to 3000.

question: Test an Express GET /health route using Supertest.
example_answer: const request = require('supertest'); const app = require('./app'); request(app).get('/health').expect(200).expect('Content-Type', /json/).then(res => { console.log(res.body); });
correctness: Supertest sends a request and asserts status and content type.

question: Avoid XSS by inserting user content safely into the DOM.
example_answer: Use textContent instead of innerHTML: const div = document.createElement('div'); div.textContent = userInput; document.body.appendChild(div); This ensures characters are escaped.
correctness: textContent escapes HTML; innerHTML should only be used with sanitized content.

question: Create a products table with a default created_at timestamp.
example_answer: CREATE TABLE products ( id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, price DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP );
correctness: Table includes primary key, required fields, and automatic timestamp.

question: Create a database user with least privilege for the application.
example_answer: CREATE USER 'appuser'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 's3cr3t'; GRANT SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE ON shopdb.* TO 'appuser'@'localhost'; FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
correctness: User is created with only necessary permissions for the application.

question: Build a form component that handles input validation and displays errors inline.
example_answer:
function ContactForm() { const [form, setForm] = React.useState({name: '', email: '', message: ''}); const [errors, setErrors] = React.useState({}); const validate = () => { const newErrors = {}; if (!form.name) newErrors.name = 'Name required'; if (!/^[^@]+@[^@]+\.[^@]+$/.test(form.email)) newErrors.email = 'Invalid email'; if (!form.message) newErrors.message = 'Message required'; setErrors(newErrors); return Object.keys(newErrors).length === 0; }; const handleSubmit = (e) => { e.preventDefault(); if (validate()) console.log('Form valid'); }; return (
setForm({...form, name: e.target.value})} placeholder="Name" />{errors.name && {errors.name}} setForm({...form, email: e.target.value})} placeholder="Email" />{errors.email && {errors.email}}
); }
correctness: Component validates input on submit and displays error messages inline before submission.

question: Implement a debounce function that delays execution of a function.
example_answer: function debounce(fn, delay) { let timeoutId; return function(...args) { clearTimeout(timeoutId); timeoutId = setTimeout(() => fn(...args), delay); }; } const search = debounce((query) => console.log(`Searching: ${query}`), 300);
correctness: Function delays execution and cancels previous calls if invoked before delay expires.

question: Build a throttle function that limits function calls to a maximum frequency.
example_answer: function throttle(fn, interval) { let lastCalled = 0; return function(...args) { const now = Date.now(); if (now - lastCalled >= interval) { lastCalled = now; fn(...args); } }; }
correctness: Function limits execution to once per interval regardless of call frequency.

question: Create an accessible form with proper labels, ARIA attributes, and error messages.
correctness: Form includes proper labels, ARIA attributes, and error message containers for screen readers.

question: Implement Array.map() functionality manually.
example_answer: function map(arr, fn) { const result = []; for (let i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) result.push(fn(arr[i], i, arr)); return result; }
correctness: Maps function over array elements returning new array.

question: Write Array.filter() from scratch.
example_answer: function filter(arr, predicate) { const result = []; for (let i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) if (predicate(arr[i], i, arr)) result.push(arr[i]); return result; }
correctness: Filters array based on predicate condition.

question: Implement Array.reduce() for accumulation.
example_answer: function reduce(arr, fn, initial) { let acc = initial; for (let i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) acc = fn(acc, arr[i], i, arr); return acc; }
correctness: Reduces array to single value using accumulator.

question: Build string manipulation with charAt and substring.
example_answer: const str = 'Hello'; const char = str.charAt(0); const sub = str.substring(0, 3); console.log(char, sub);
correctness: String methods access individual characters and substrings.

question: Create object iteration with Object.keys() and forEach.
example_answer: Object.keys(obj).forEach(key => { console.log(key, obj[key]); });
correctness: Iterates object properties using keys array.

question: Implement clone with spread operator.
example_answer: const clone = { ...original }; const arrClone = [...originalArray];
correctness: Spread operator creates shallow copies of objects and arrays.

question: Build try-catch error handling.
example_answer: try { riskyOperation(); } catch (err) { console.log('Error:', err.message); } finally { cleanup(); }
correctness: Try-catch-finally handles exceptions with cleanup.

question: Create setTimeout vs setInterval comparison.
example_answer: const timeout = setTimeout(() => console.log('Once'), 1000); const interval = setInterval(() => console.log('Repeatedly'), 1000); clearTimeout(timeout); clearInterval(interval);
correctness: Timeout fires once, interval repeats until cleared.

question: Implement switch statement for branching.
example_answer: switch (userType) { case 'admin': showAdminPanel(); break; case 'user': showUser Dashboard(); break; default: showLogin(); }
correctness: Switch statement handles multiple cases with fallthrough prevention.

question: Build with-statement alternative using locals.
example_answer: function withContext(obj, fn) { return fn.call(obj); } withContext(user, function() { console.log(this.name); });
correctness: Call binds function context to object explicitly.

question: Create template literals for string interpolation.
example_answer: const name = 'Alice'; const greeting = `Hello, ${name}! You are ${age} years old.`;
correctness: Template literals embed expressions with backticks.

question: Implement destructuring assignment.
example_answer: const {name, age} = user; const [first, second, ...rest] = arrayData;
correctness: Destructuring extracts values from objects and arrays.

question: Build arrow function with different return.
example_answer: const add = (a, b) => a + b; const greet = (name) => { console.log(`Hi ${name}`); return true; };
correctness: Arrow functions with implicit vs explicit returns.

question: Create setTimeout promise wrapper.
example_answer: function delay(ms) { return new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, ms)); } await delay(1000);

question: Implement JSON parse and stringify.
example_answer: const json = JSON.stringify({name: 'Bob', age: 30}); const obj = JSON.parse(json);

question: Build comparison operators and type coercion.
example_answer: console.log(5 == '5'); console.log(5 === '5'); console.log(null == undefined);

question: Create nullish coalescing operator usage.
example_answer: const value = input ?? defaultValue; const config = userConfig ?? loadDefaults();

question: Implement optional chaining.

question: Build for-of loop iteration.
example_answer: for (const item of array) { process(item); } for (const char of string) { count(char); }

question: Create Map and Set usage.
example_answer: const map = new Map(); map.set('key', 'value'); const set = new Set([1, 2, 3]); set.add(4);

question: Build component lifecycle with useEffect cleanup.

question: Implement useState for boolean toggle.
example_answer: const [isOpen, setIsOpen] = useState(false); <button onClick={() => setIsOpen(!isOpen)}>Toggle</button>

question: Create error handling in component.
example_answer: const [error, setError] = useState(null); {error && <ErrorBox message={error} />}

question: Implement click handler with parameters.
example_answer: <button onClick={() => handleDelete(item.id)}>Delete</button>

question: Build nested component structure.
example_answer: <App><Header /><MainContent><Sidebar /><Article /></MainContent><Footer /></App>
correctness: Nested components compose larger UI hierarchies.

question: Create component return type check.

correctness: Check component type before rendering.

question: Implement memo for re-render prevention.
example_answer: const MemoizedButton = React.memo(Button);
correctness: Memo prevents re-render if props unchanged.

question: Build key prop importance in lists.
example_answer:
{items.map(i =>
  • {i.name}
    • )}
correctness: Key prop helps React track list items across renders.

question: Create component composition pattern.
example_answer:
function Layout({children}) { return
{children}
; }
correctness: Children prop creates reusable layout components.

question: Create CSS custom properties (variables).
example_answer: :root { --main-color: #3498db; } .element { color: var(--main-color); }
correctness: CSS variables enable theme reusability.

question: Build media query for mobile optimization.
example_answer: @media (max-width: 768px) { .container { width: 100%; flex-direction: column; } }
correctness: Media query adapts layout for mobile screens.

question: Implement box-shadow for depth.
example_answer: .card { box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.1), 0 10px 20px rgba(0,0,0,0.15); }
correctness: Multiple shadows create layered depth effect.

question: Create text truncation with ellipsis.
example_answer: .title { white-space: nowrap; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis; }
correctness: Ellipsis truncates overflowing text.

question: Build gradient text effect.
example_answer: .text { background: linear-gradient(90deg, blue, purple); -webkit-background-clip: text; color: transparent; }
correctness: Gradient background with text clipping creates colored text.

question: Implement flexbox gap property.
example_answer: .flex-container { display: flex; gap: 16px; }
correctness: Gap property adds consistent spacing between flex items.

question: Create responsive font scaling.
example_answer: body { font-size: clamp(16px, 2vw, 24px); }
correctness: Clamp scales font between min and max sizes.

question: Build transform rotate animation.
example_answer: @keyframes spin { from { transform: rotate(0deg); } to { transform: rotate(360deg); } } .spinner { animation: spin 2s linear infinite; }
correctness: Keyframe animation rotates element continuously.

question: Implement letter-spacing and line-height.
example_answer: .paragraph { letter-spacing: 1px; line-height: 1.6; }
correctness: Spacing properties improve text readability.

question: Create pseudo-element styling.
example_answer: .button::before { content: '→'; margin-right: 4px; } .button::after { content: ''; width: 100%; }
correctness: Pseudo-elements add decorative content without HTML.

question: Build cursor pointer on buttons.
example_answer: button { cursor: pointer; } .disabled { cursor: not-allowed; opacity: 0.5; }
correctness: Cursor property indicates interactive elements.

question: Implement aspect-ratio for responsive media.
example_answer: .video { aspect-ratio: 16 / 9; width: 100%; }
correctness: Aspect-ratio maintains proportions with flexible width.

question: Create backdrop blur effect.
example_answer: .modal-overlay { backdrop-filter: blur(4px); background: rgba(0,0,0,0.5); }
correctness: Backdrop filter blurs content behind overlay.

question: Build z-index stacking context.
example_answer: .modal { z-index: 1000; } .tooltip { z-index: 1001; } .dropdown { z-index: 900; }
correctness: Z-index controls layering with consistent numbering.

question: Implement word-break for long text.
example_answer: .url { word-break: break-all; }
correctness: Word-break splits long unbroken words.

question: Create border-radius rounded corners.
example_answer: .pill { border-radius: 50px; } .subtle { border-radius: 4px; }
correctness: Border-radius creates rounded or pill-shaped elements.

question: Build opacity hover effect.
example_answer: .image { opacity: 0.8; transition: opacity 0.3s; } .image:hover { opacity: 1; }
correctness: Opacity transition creates fade-in on hover.

question: Implement overflow hidden for masking.
example_answer: .container { width: 200px; height: 200px; overflow: hidden; } .child { width: 300px; }
correctness: Overflow hidden hides child content beyond boundary.

question: Create text-shadow for depth.
example_answer: .heading { text-shadow: 2px 2px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); }
correctness: Text-shadow adds depth to text layers.

question: Build column layout for text.
example_answer: .article { column-count: 2; column-gap: 20px; }
correctness: Column property creates newspaper-style layout.

question: Create CORS middleware for cross-origin requests.
example_answer: const cors = require('cors'); app.use(cors()); app.options('*', cors());
correctness: CORS middleware enables cross-origin requests safely.

question: Implement request body parsing.
example_answer: app.use(express.json()); app.use(express.urlencoded({extended: true}));
correctness: Middleware parses JSON and URL-encoded bodies.

question: Build route parameter extraction.
example_answer: app.get('/users/:id/posts/:postId', (req, res) => { const {id, postId} = req.params; });
correctness: Route parameters captured in req.params object.

question: Create query string parsing.
example_answer: app.get('/search', (req, res) => { const {q, sort} = req.query; });
correctness: Query parameters available in req.query object.

question: Implement status code responses.
example_answer: res.status(200).json({ok: true}); res.status(404).json({error: 'Not found'}); res.status(500).send('Server error');
correctness: Status codes indicate response outcome.

question: Build redirect to another route.
example_answer: res.redirect(301, '/new-url'); res.redirect('back');
correctness: Redirect sends client to different URL.

question: Create async route handler with try-catch.
example_answer: app.get('/api/data', async (req, res) => { try { const data = await fetchData(); res.json(data); } catch (err) { res.status(500).json({error: 'Failed'}); } });
correctness: Async handler with error catching.

question: Implement middleware chaining.
example_answer: app.use(authenticate, validate, processRequest);
correctness: Multiple middleware execute in order.

question: Build file upload handling.
example_answer: const multer = require('multer'); const upload = multer({dest: 'uploads/'}); app.post('/upload', upload.single('file'), (req, res) => { res.json({filename: req.file.filename}); });
correctness: Multer middleware handles file uploads.

question: Create static file serving.
example_answer: app.use(express.static('public')); app.use('/assets', express.static('assets'));
correctness: Static middleware serves files from directory.

question: Implement 404 error handling.
example_answer: app.use((req, res) => { res.status(404).json({error: 'Route not found'}); });
correctness: Catch-all middleware handles undefined routes.

question: Build response headers.
example_answer: res.setHeader('X-Custom-Header', 'value'); res.type('application/json').send(data);
correctness: Headers customize response metadata.

question: Create cookie handling.
example_answer: res.cookie('sessionId', token, {httpOnly: true, maxAge: 3600000}); const sid = req.cookies.sessionId;
correctness: Cookies store client data with security options.

question: Implement request timing middleware.
example_answer: app.use((req, res, next) => { const start = Date.now(); res.on('finish', () => { console.log(`${req.method} ${req.path} took ${Date.now() - start}ms`); }); next(); });
correctness: Middleware measures request duration.

question: Build next-error pattern.
example_answer: app.get('/error', (req, res, next) => { next(new Error('Something failed')); });
correctness: Next with error passes to error handler.

question: Create table with constraints.
example_answer: CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT, email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL, name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP);
correctness: Table includes constraints for integrity.

question: Write SELECT with AND/OR conditions.
example_answer: SELECT * FROM products WHERE (category = 'books' OR category = 'media') AND price < 30;
correctness: Multiple conditions filter results.

question: Build LIKE wildcard matching.
example_answer: SELECT * FROM users WHERE email LIKE '%@gmail.com' OR name LIKE 'John%';
correctness: LIKE pattern matches partial strings.

question: Implement BETWEEN for range queries.
example_answer: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE order_date BETWEEN '2026-01-01' AND '2026-02-28';
correctness: BETWEEN filters inclusive range.

question: Create DISTINCT for unique values.
example_answer: SELECT DISTINCT category FROM products;
correctness: DISTINCT removes duplicate results.

question: Build LIMIT and OFFSET pagination.
example_answer: SELECT * FROM products LIMIT 10 OFFSET 20;
correctness: LIMIT retrieves page of results with OFFSET.

question: Implement CASE for conditional logic.
example_answer: SELECT id, name, CASE WHEN age < 18 THEN 'Minor' ELSE 'Adult' END as status FROM users;
correctness: CASE adds computed columns with conditions.

question: Create UNION combining results.
example_answer: SELECT name FROM users UNION SELECT company_name FROM companies;
correctness: UNION combines multiple query results.

question: Build INNER JOIN with condition.
example_answer: SELECT users.name, orders.total FROM users INNER JOIN orders ON users.id = orders.user_id WHERE users.status = 'active';
correctness: INNER JOIN with WHERE filters both tables.

question: Implement RIGHT JOIN.
example_answer: SELECT employees.name, departments.name FROM employees RIGHT JOIN departments ON employees.dept_id = departments.id;
correctness: RIGHT JOIN all rows from right table.

question: Create UPDATE with JOIN.
example_answer: UPDATE products SET price = price * 0.9 WHERE category_id IN (SELECT id FROM categories WHERE is_sale = true);
correctness: Subquery filters UPDATE targets.

question: Build data aggregation with statistics.
example_answer: SELECT COUNT(*) as total, SUM(amount) as revenue, AVG(amount) as average FROM orders;
correctness: Aggregates compute statistics.

question: Implement self-join for relationships.
example_answer: SELECT e1.name as employee, e2.name as manager FROM employees e1 JOIN employees e2 ON e1.manager_id = e2.id;
correctness: Self-join finds related rows in same table.

question: Create transaction for data integrity.
example_answer: BEGIN; INSERT INTO accounts (id, balance) VALUES (1, 1000); INSERT INTO transactions (account_id, amount) VALUES (1, 200); COMMIT;
correctness: Transaction ensures all-or-nothing execution.

question: Build explain plan for query analysis.
example_answer: EXPLAIN SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = 'test@example.com'; EXPLAIN SELECT * FROM orders WHERE date > '2026-01-01';
correctness: EXPLAIN shows query execution strategy.

question: Import modules using require.
example_answer: const express = require('express'); const {readFile, writeFile} = require('fs').promises;
correctness: Require imports CommonJS modules.

question: Export functions and objects.
example_answer: module.exports = {connect, disconnect}; function connect() { /*...*/ }
correctness: Module.exports exposes public API.

question: Build package.json scripts.
example_answer: {"scripts": {"start": "node app.js", "dev": "nodemon app.js", "test": "jest"}} npm start
correctness: Package.json defines runtime commands.

question: Create error handling with callbacks.
example_answer: fs.readFile('file.txt', (err, data) => { if (err) console.error(err); else console.log(data); });
correctness: Callback pattern handles async errors.

question: Implement Promise.all for parallel.
example_answer: Promise.all([fetch('url1'), fetch('url2'), fetch('url3')]).then(results => process(results));
correctness: Promise.all waits for all promises.

question: Build async-await error handling.
example_answer: async function process() { try { const data = await fetchData(); } catch (e) { console.error(e); } }
correctness: Async-await with try-catch for errors.

question: Create global variables and constants.
example_answer: global.APP_NAME = 'MyApp'; const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;
correctness: Global and constants available everywhere.

question: Implement event emitter pattern.
example_answer: const EventEmitter = require('events'); const emitter = new EventEmitter(); emitter.on('event', () => {}); emitter.emit('event');
correctness: Event emitter enables pub-sub pattern.

question: Build streaming for large files.
example_answer: const stream = fs.createReadStream('large.txt'); stream.on('data', chunk => process(chunk));

example_answer: const {spawn} = require('child_process'); const proc = spawn('node', ['script.js']); proc.stdout.on('data', data => console.log(data));

Implement Module Pattern for encapsulation.
example_answer: const module = (function() { let private = 0; return { increment: () => ++private, getCount: () => private }; })();
correctness: IIFE returns object with public methods accessing private state.

question: Create Singleton pattern.
example_answer: const Singleton = (function() { let instance; function createInstance() { return {id: Math.random()}; } return { getInstance: () => { if (!instance) instance = createInstance(); return instance; } }; })();
correctness: Singleton ensures only one instance exists.

question: Build Observer pattern.
example_answer: class Observer { constructor(name) { this.name = name; } update(data) { console.log(`${this.name} updated: ${data}`); } } const subject = {observers: [], notify: function(data) { this.observers.forEach(o => o.update(data)); }};
correctness: Subject notifies all observers of changes.

question: Implement Factory pattern.
example_answer: function createShape(type) { if (type === 'circle') return {draw: () => 'Circle'}; if (type === 'square') return {draw: () => 'Square'}; }
correctness: Factory creates objects without exposing instantiation logic.

question: Create Builder pattern.
example_answer: class UserBuilder { name(n) { this._name = n; return this; } email(e) { this._email = e; return this; } build() { return {name: this._name, email: this._email}; } }
correctness: Builder pattern constructs complex objects step by step.

question: Build Strategy pattern.
example_answer: const strategies = {fast: (a,b) => a+b, slow: (a,b) => { console.time(); return a+b; }}; function compute(strategy, a, b) { return strategies[strategy](a, b); }
correctness: Strategy encapsulates different algorithms.

question: Implement Proxy pattern for logging.
example_answer: const handler = {get: (t, p) => { console.log(`accessing ${p}`); return t[p]; }}; const proxy = new Proxy({foo: 'bar'}, handler);
correctness: Proxy intercepts and logs property access.

question: Create Decorator pattern.
example_answer: function decorator(fn) { return function(...args) { console.log('before'); const result = fn(...args); console.log('after'); return result; }; }
correctness: Decorator adds behavior without modifying function.

question: Build Iterator pattern.
example_answer: const iterator = {current: 0, items: [1,2,3], next() { return {value: this.items[this.current++], done: this.current > this.items.length}; }};
correctness: Iterator provides sequential access to elements.

question: Implement Prototype chain.
example_answer: function Animal(name) { this.name = name; } Animal.prototype.speak = function() { return `${this.name} sound`; }; const dog = new Animal('Dog'); dog.speak();
correctness: Prototype chain enables method inheritance.

question: Create WeakMap for private data.
example_answer: const wm = new WeakMap(); const obj = {}; wm.set(obj, 'private'); console.log(wm.get(obj));
correctness: WeakMap stores object-keyed data that allows garbage collection.

question: Build Symbol for unique property.
example_answer: const id = Symbol('id'); const obj = {[id]: 123}; console.log(obj[id]);
correctness: Symbols create unique property keys.

question: Implement Reflect API.
example_answer: Reflect.has(obj, 'prop'); Reflect.get(obj, 'prop'); Reflect.set(obj, 'prop', 'value');
correctness: Reflect API provides meta-operations on objects.

question: Create async generator function.
example_answer: async function* fetchPages() { for (let i = 1; i <= 3; i++) { yield await fetch(`/api/page/${i}`); } } for await (const page of fetchPages()) { process(page); }
correctness: Async generators yield promises in sequence.

question: Build AbortController for cancellation.
example_answer: const controller = new AbortController(); fetch('/api/data', {signal: controller.signal}); controller.abort();
correctness: AbortController cancels fetch requests.

question: Create Web Workers for threading.
example_answer: const worker = new Worker('worker.js'); worker.postMessage({cmd: 'start'}); worker.onmessage = (e) => console.log(e.data);
correctness: Web Workers run scripts in background threads.

question: Implement service worker registration.
example_answer: navigator.serviceWorker.register('sw.js').then(reg => console.log('Registered')).catch(err => console.error(err));
correctness: Service workers enable offline functionality.

question: Build BigInt for large numbers.
example_answer: const big = BigInt('12345678901234567890'); console.log(big + BigInt(1));
correctness: BigInt handles integers larger than Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER.

question: Create Intl API for localization.
example_answer: const formatter = new Intl.NumberFormat('en-US', {style: 'currency', currency: 'USD'}); console.log(formatter.format(1234.56));
correctness: Intl API formats numbers, dates, strings by locale.

question: Implement Promise.any().
example_answer: Promise.any([promise1, promise2, promise3]).then(first => console.log(first));
correctness: Promise.any returns first fulfilled promise.

question: Build Error causes for debugging.
example_answer: try { throw new Error('Original'); } catch (e) { throw new Error('Context', {cause: e}); }
correctness: Error.cause links errors in chains.

question: Create fetch with AbortController timeout.
example_answer: const controller = new AbortController(); const timeout = setTimeout(() => controller.abort(), 5000); fetch('/api', {signal: controller.signal}).finally(() => clearTimeout(timeout));
correctness: AbortController timeout cancels requests after duration.

question: Implement structuredClone().
example_answer: const cloned = structuredClone({a: 1, b: {c: 2}}); cloned.b.c = 999;
correctness: StructuredClone deep clones including prototypes.

question: Build FinalizationRegistry for cleanup.
example_answer: const registry = new FinalizationRegistry((value) => console.log(`${value} was garbage collected`)); registry.register(object, 'myLabel');
correctness: FinalizationRegistry callback on garbage collection.

question: Implement useCallback for memoized callback.
example_answer: const memoCallback = useCallback(() => { doSomething(a, b); }, [a, b]);
correctness: UseCallback memoizes callback with dependency array.

question: Create useMemo for expensive computation.
example_answer: const expensiveResult = useMemo(() => computeExpensive(input), [input]);
correctness: UseMemo caches computed value.

question: Build Context API for global state.
example_answer: const ThemeContext = React.createContext(); <ThemeContext.Provider value='dark'><Component /></ThemeContext.Provider>
correctness: Context passes data through component tree without props drilling.

question: Implement useContext hook.
example_answer: const theme = useContext(ThemeContext); const {user, setUser} = useContext(UserContext);
correctness: UseContext accesses context value.

question: Create custom hook pattern.
example_answer: function useWindowSize() { const [size, setSize] = useState({width: 0, height: 0}); useEffect(() => { const handler = () => setSize({width: window.innerWidth, height: window.innerHeight}); window.addEventListener('resize', handler); return () => window.removeEventListener('resize', handler); }, []); return size; }
correctness: Custom hooks encapsulate stateful logic reusably.

question: Build Higher-Order Component (HOC).
example_answer: function withTheme(Component) { return (props) => <Component {...props} theme='dark' />; } const ThemedComponent = withTheme(MyComponent);
correctness: HOC wraps component to inject props.

} />
correctness: Render prop allows component to provide rendering logic.

question: Create error boundary.
example_answer: class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component { componentDidCatch(err) { setError(err); } render() { if (error) return <Error />; return this.props.children; } }
correctness: Error boundary catches descendant errors.

question: Build useReducer for complex state.
example_answer: const [state, dispatch] = useReducer((s, a) => ({...s, count: s.count + a.val}), {count: 0}); dispatch({val: 5});
correctness: UseReducer manages complex state with actions.

question: Implement lazy loading with Suspense.
example_answer: const LazyComp = React.lazy(() => import('./Component')); <Suspense fallback={<Loading />}><LazyComp /></Suspense>
correctness: Lazy loading splits code, Suspense shows loading state.

question: Build controlled form validation.
example_answer: const [form, setForm] = useState({email: ''}); const [errors, setErrors] = useState({});
correctness: Controlled form stores state and validation errors.

question: Implement debounce search input.
example_answer: const debouncedSearch = useCallback(debounce((query) => search(query), 300), []);
correctness: Debounce reduces search API calls while typing.

question: Create infinite scroll component.
example_answer: useEffect(() => { const observer = new IntersectionObserver(entries => { if (entries[0].isIntersecting) loadMore(); }); observer.observe(lastItemRef.current); }, []);
correctness: IntersectionObserver detects scroll to load more items.

question: Build drag-and-drop.
example_answer: const handleDragStart = (e) => { e.dataTransfer.setData('text/html', e.currentTarget.id); }; const handleDrop = (e) => { const id = e.dataTransfer.getData('text/html'); };
correctness: Drag events with dataTransfer enable rearrangement.

question: Implement portals for modals.
example_answer: ReactDOM.createPortal(<Modal />, document.getElementById('modal-root'));
correctness: Portals render outside normal DOM hierarchy.

question: Create animation with react-spring.
example_answer: <animated.div style={{opacity: spring(isVisible ? 1 : 0)}} />
correctness: React-spring provides spring-based animations.

question: Build form library integration.
example_answer: const {register, handleSubmit, errors} = useForm(); {errors.email && Error}
correctness: Form libraries like react-hook-form manage complex forms.

question: Implement internationalization.
example_answer:
const i18n = useI18n();
{i18n.t('welcome', {name: user.name})}
correctness: I18n hooks provide translated strings.

question: Create virtualized list.
example_answer: <FixedSizeList height={600} itemCount={1000} itemSize={35}><Row /></FixedSizeList>
correctness: Virtualization renders only visible list items.

question: Build WebSocket connection.
example_answer: useEffect(() => { const ws = new WebSocket('wss://api.example.com'); ws.onmessage = (e) => setData(e.data); return () => ws.close(); }, []);
correctness: WebSocket hook manages real-time connection.

question: Implement feature flags.
example_answer: if (featureFlags.newDashboard) { return <NewDashboard />; } return <OldDashboard />;
correctness: Feature flags toggle components conditionally.

question: Create performance monitoring.
example_answer: useEffect(() => { const perf = performance.mark('component-render'); return () => { performance.mark('component-end'); performance.measure('render', 'component-render', 'component-end'); }; }, []);
correctness: Performance API measures component render time.

question: Implement CSS Grid with auto-placement.
example_answer: .grid {display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(200px, 1fr)); grid-auto-rows: minmax(150px, auto); grid-auto-flow: dense;}
correctness: Auto-placement fills grid efficiently.

question: Build CSS subgrid for nested layouts.
example_answer: .nested { grid-column: span 2; display: grid; grid-template-columns: subgrid; }
correctness: Subgrid aligns nested grid with parent.

question: Create CSS mask for effects.
example_answer: .masked { mask-image: url(#mask); mask-size: 200% 200%; mask-position: 0 0; }
correctness: Mask clips element visibility with shape.

question: Implement clip-path animation.
example_answer: .element { clip-path: polygon(0 0, 100% 0, 100% 100%, 0 100%); animation: unclip 1s forwards; } @keyframes unclip { to { clip-path: polygon(0 0, 100% 0, 0 100%, 0 100%); } }
correctness: Animated clip-path reveals content progressively.

question: Build CSS filters effect.
example_answer: .image { filter: brightness(1.1) contrast(1.2) saturate(1.5) hue-rotate(10deg) drop-shadow(0 0 10px rgba(0,0,0,0.3)); }
correctness: Multiple filters combine visual effects.

question: Create will-change optimization.
example_answer: .animation { will-change: transform, opacity; animation: fadeSlide 1s; }
correctness: Will-change hints browser for optimization.

question: Implement container queries.
example_answer: @container (min-width: 400px) { .card { display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; } }
correctness: Container queries respond to container size.

question: Build CSS nesting.
example_answer: .card { background: white; &:hover { box-shadow: 0 4px 8px; } &-title { font-size: 1.2rem; } }
correctness: CSS nesting reduces selector repetition.

question: Create mix-blend-mode effects.
example_answer: .overlay { mix-blend-mode: multiply; opacity: 0.7; }
correctness: Mix-blend-mode blends element with background.

question: Implement backdrop-filter with effects.
example_answer: .frosted { backdrop-filter: blur(10px) brightness(0.8); background: rgba(255,255,255,0.1); }
correctness: Backdrop filter creates frosted effect.

question: Build scroll-snap behavior.
example_answer: .container { scroll-snap-type: x mandatory; overflow-x: scroll; } .item { scroll-snap-align: center; scroll-snap-stop: always; }
correctness: Scroll-snap aligns scrolled items.

question: Create scroll-driven animation.
example_answer: @supports (animation-timeline: scroll()) { .progress { animation-timeline: scroll(nearest); animation: width 1s linear; } }
correctness: Animation timeline syncs with scroll position.

question: Implement :has() selector.
example_answer: .card:has(img) { padding: 20px; } .list:has(> .active) { background: highlight; }
correctness: Has selector styles based on children.

question: Build aspect-ratio auto.
example_answer: .auto-square { aspect-ratio: 1; width: 100%; }
correctness: Aspect-ratio maintains square with flexible width.

question: Create font-variation-settings.
example_answer: .heading { font-family: 'Roboto Flex'; font-variation-settings: 'wght' 700, 'wdth' 85; }
correctness: Variable fonts adjust weight and width.

question: Implement text-wrap balance.
example_answer: .title { max-width: 400px; text-wrap: balance; }
correctness: Text-wrap balance optimizes line breaks.

question: Build linear-gradient animation.
example_answer: .animated { background: linear-gradient(90deg, red 0%, blue 100%); background-size: 200% 100%; animation: shift 3s infinite; } @keyframes shift { 0% { background-position: 0; } 100% { background-position: 100%; } }
correctness: Animated gradient shifts color positions.

question: Create calc with operators.
example_answer: .sidebar-width { width: calc(100% - 250px); margin: calc(1rem * 2); padding: calc(var(--base) * 1.5); }
correctness: Calc mixes units and variables.

question: Implement counter with pseudo-elements.
example_answer: .list { counter-reset: item; } .list li { counter-increment: item; } .list li::before { content: counter(item) '. '; }
correctness: Counters auto-number list items.

question: Build responsive web app viewport.
example_answer: html { font-size: clamp(0.875rem, 2vw, 1.25rem); }
correctness: Clamp scales font between viewport sizes.

question: Create object-fit for images.
example_answer: .image { width: 300px; height: 300px; object-fit: cover; object-position: center; }
correctness: Object-fit scales image into container.

question: Implement @supports for feature detection.
example_answer: @supports (display: grid) { .layout { display: grid; } } @supports not (display: grid) { .layout { display: flex; } }
correctness: Supports applies CSS if browser feature exists.

question: Build overscroll-behavior.
example_answer: body { overscroll-behavior: contain; } .modal { overscroll-behavior-y: none; }
correctness: Overscroll-behavior prevents scroll chaining.

question: Create color-scheme for dark mode.
example_answer: :root { color-scheme: light dark; } @media (prefers-color-scheme: dark) { :root { --bg: #1a1a1a; --text: #fff; } }
correctness: Color-scheme enables light and dark themes.

question: Build middleware with WebSockets.
example_answer: const app = require('express')(); const http = require('http').createServer(app); const io = require('socket.io')(http); io.on('connection', (socket) => { socket.emit('connected'); socket.on('message', (data) => io.emit('message', data)); });
correctness: Socket.io adds real-time bidirectional communication.

question: Implement request compression.
example_answer: const compression = require('compression'); app.use(compression()); app.get('/large', (req, res) => res.json({data: largeArray}));
correctness: Compression middleware gzips responses.

question: Create request timeout handling.
example_answer: app.use((req, res, next) => { req.setTimeout(10000, () => res.status(408).send('Timeout')); next(); });
correctness: Timeout middleware prevents hanging requests.

question: Build HTTPS server.
example_answer: const https = require('https'); const fs = require('fs'); const options = { key: fs.readFileSync('key.pem'), cert: fs.readFileSync('cert.pem') }; https.createServer(options, app).listen(443);
correctness: HTTPS server requires key and certificate.

question: Implement session management with passport.
example_answer: const passport = require('passport'); const LocalStrategy = require('passport-local').Strategy; app.use(passport.session()); passport.use(new LocalStrategy((username, password, done) => { validateUser(username, password, done); }));
correctness: Passport provides authentication strategy framework.

question: Create API versioning.
example_answer: app.use('/api/v1', require('./routes/v1')); app.use('/api/v2', require('./routes/v2'));
correctness: URL-based versioning supports multiple API versions.

question: Build request body size limit.
example_answer: app.use(express.json({limit: '10mb'})); app.use(express.urlencoded({limit: '10mb', extended: true}));
correctness: Size limit prevents malformed large payloads.

question: Implement request ID tracking.
example_answer: const {v4: uuid} = require('uuid'); app.use((req, res, next) => { req.id = uuid(); res.locals.requestId = req.id; next(); });
correctness: Request ID enables request tracing.

question: Create streaming responses.
example_answer: app.get('/download', (req, res) => { const stream = fs.createReadStream('large-file'); stream.pipe(res); stream.on('error', (err) => res.status(500).send('Error')); });
correctness: Streaming sends large files without buffering.

question: Build openAPI/Swagger documentation.
example_answer: const swaggerJsdoc = require('swagger-jsdoc'); app.use('/docs', swaggerUi.serve, swaggerUi.setup(specs));
correctness: Swagger generates interactive API documentation.

question: Implement GraphQL endpoint.
example_answer: const {graphqlHTTP} = require('express-graphql'); app.use('/graphql', graphqlHTTP({schema: mySchema, rootValue: resolver, graphiql: true}));
correctness: GraphQL endpoint enables flexible queries.

question: Create request validation middleware.
example_answer: app.post('/users', validateBody(schema), (req, res) => { createUser(req.body); });
correctness: Validation middleware checks request before handler.

question: Build health check endpoint.
example_answer: app.get('/health', (req, res) => { const health = {db: isDbConnected(), cache: isCacheOpen()}; const status = Object.values(health).every(v => v) ? 200 : 503; res.status(status).json(health); });
correctness: Health check monitors service dependencies.

question: Implement graceful shutdown.
example_answer: const server = app.listen(3000); process.on('SIGTERM', async () => { server.close(() => process.exit(0)); setTimeout(() => process.exit(1), 30000); });
correctness: Graceful shutdown closes connections properly.

question: Create environment-based configuration.
example_answer: const config = { production: {...}, development: {...} }[process.env.NODE_ENV]; app.use(config);
correctness: Configuration changes by environment.

question: Build circuit breaker pattern.
example_answer: const CircuitBreaker = require('opossum'); const breaker = new CircuitBreaker(externalService, {timeout: 3000}); breaker.fallback(() => cachedData);
correctness: Circuit breaker prevents cascading failures.

question: Implement rate limiting by user.
example_answer: const rateLimit = require('express-rate-limit'); const limiter = rateLimit({keyGenerator: (req) => req.user.id, windowMs: 15*60*1000, max: 100}); app.use('/api', limiter);
correctness: Rate limiting per user prevents abuse.

question: Create content negotiation.
example_answer: app.get('/data', (req, res) => { if (req.accepts('json')) res.json(data); else if (req.accepts('xml')) res.type('xml').send(xmlData); else res.type('txt').send(txtData); });
correctness: Content negotiation returns appropriate format.

question: Build dependency injection.
example_answer: function createUserController(userService) { return { getUser: (req, res) => res.json(userService.find(req.params.id)); }; }
correctness: DI injects dependencies for testability.

question: Implement window functions for analytics.
example_answer: SELECT id, name, salary, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY department ORDER BY salary DESC) as rank FROM employees;
correctness: Window functions compute aggregate values per row.

question: Create recursive CTE.
example_answer: WITH RECURSIVE hierarchy AS (SELECT id, parent_id, name FROM categories WHERE parent_id IS NULL UNION ALL SELECT c.id, c.parent_id, c.name FROM categories c INNER JOIN hierarchy h ON c.parent_id = h.id) SELECT * FROM hierarchy;
correctness: Recursive CTEs traverse hierarchical data.

question: Build JSON operations.
example_answer: SELECT JSON_EXTRACT(data, '$.user.name') as user_name FROM logs WHERE JSON_CONTAINS(data, '{"level":"error"}');
correctness: JSON functions query document-style data.

question: Implement full-text search.
example_answer: CREATE FULLTEXT INDEX idx_content ON articles(title, content); SELECT * FROM articles WHERE MATCH(title, content) AGAINST('specific query' IN BOOLEAN MODE);
correctness: Full-text index enables text search.

question: Create spatial queries.
example_answer: SELECT * FROM locations WHERE ST_Distance(point, ST_Point(0, 0)) < 1000;
correctness: Spatial functions query geographic data.

question: Build materialized view equivalent.
example_answer: CREATE TABLE category_stats AS SELECT category, COUNT(*) as count, AVG(price) as avg FROM products GROUP BY category; CREATE TRIGGER refresh_stats AFTER UPDATE ON products FOR EACH ROW BEGIN DELETE FROM category_stats; INSERT INTO category_stats SELECT ... END;
correctness: Materialized views cache expensive queries.

question: Implement partitioning by range.
example_answer: CREATE TABLE sales (id INT, amount DECIMAL, date DATE) PARTITION BY RANGE (YEAR(date)) (PARTITION p2024 VALUES LESS THAN (2025), PARTITION p2025 VALUES LESS THAN (2026));
correctness: Partitioning splits large tables by range.

question: Create check constraint.
example_answer: CREATE TABLE users (id INT, age INT CHECK (age >= 18), email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE, PRIMARY KEY (id));
correctness: CHECK constraint validates column values.

question: Build generated columns.
example_answer: CREATE TABLE products (price DECIMAL(10,2), tax_rate DECIMAL(3,2), tax_amount DECIMAL(10,2) GENERATED ALWAYS AS (price * tax_rate) STORED);
correctness: Generated columns compute values automatically.

question: Implement grant/revoke permissions.
example_answer: GRANT SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE ON shopdb.* TO 'app_user'@'app.server'; REVOKE DELETE ON shopdb.* FROM 'app_user'@'app.server';
correctness: Grant/revoke controls user permissions precisely.

question: Create connection pool.
example_answer: const pool = mysql.createPool({connectionLimit: 10, host: 'localhost', user: 'root', password: 'pass', database: 'mydb'}); pool.query('SELECT * FROM users');
correctness: Connection pool reuses database connections.

question: Build explain with format JSON.
example_answer: EXPLAIN FORMAT=JSON SELECT * FROM orders WHERE customer_id = 1; /* Shows detailed execution plan */
correctness: EXPLAIN JSON provides structured query analysis.

question: Implement virtual columns.
example_answer: ALTER TABLE users ADD COLUMN full_name VARCHAR(255) GENERATED ALWAYS AS (CONCAT(first_name, ' ', last_name));
correctness: Virtual columns combine other columns.

question: Create CASE in UPDATE.
example_answer: UPDATE inventory SET status = CASE WHEN quantity > 100 THEN 'In Stock' WHEN quantity > 0 THEN 'Low Stock' ELSE 'Out Stock' END;
correctness: CASE in UPDATE applies conditional logic.

question: Build common query patterns.
example_answer: SELECT DISTINCT u.id, u.name, COUNT(o.id) as order_count FROM users u LEFT JOIN orders o ON u.id = o.user_id GROUP BY u.id HAVING order_count > 5 ORDER BY order_count DESC;
correctness: Complex query combines joins, grouping, filtering.

question: Implement database connection pooling.
example_answer: const pool = new Pool({max: 20, idleTimeoutMillis: 30000}); pool.query('SELECT * FROM users');
correctness: Connection pool manages reusable database connections.

question: Build clustering for multi-core.
example_answer: const cluster = require('cluster'); if (cluster.isMaster) { for (let i = 0; i < numCPUs; i++) cluster.fork(); } else { app.listen(3000); }
correctness: Clustering spawns worker processes per CPU.

question: Create caching with Redis.
example_answer: const redis = require('redis'); const client = redis.createClient(); client.setex('key', 3600, data); const cached = client.get('key');
correctness: Redis in-memory cache speeds data access.

question: Implement rate limiting middleware.
example_answer: const rateLimit = require('express-rate-limit'); const limiter = rateLimit({windowMs: 15*60*1000, max: 100}); app.use('/api/', limiter);
correctness: Rate limiter prevents request flooding.

question: Build monitoring with custom metrics.
example_answer: const metrics = {requests: 0, errors: 0}; app.use((req, res) => { metrics.requests++; res.on('finish', () => { if (res.statusCode >= 400) metrics.errors++; }) });
correctness: Custom metrics track application health.

question: Implement logging with Winston.
example_answer: const winston = require('winston'); const logger = winston.createLogger({transports: [new winston.transports.File({filename: 'app.log'})]}); logger.info('Application started');
correctness: Winston provides structured logging.

question: Create process monitoring with PM2.
example_answer: pm2 start app.js -i max --name='app' --watch; pm2 logs app;
correctness: PM2 auto-restarts crashed processes and monitors logs.

question: Build Docker container.
example_answer:
FROM node:16-alpine
WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm install
COPY . .
EXPOSE 3000
CMD ['node', 'app.js']
correctness: Dockerfile containerizes Node.js application.

question: Implement secrets management.
example_answer: const dotenv = require('dotenv'); dotenv.config(); const apiKey = process.env.API_KEY;
correctness: Dotenv loads secrets from environment.

question: Create automated backups.
example_answer: const cron = require('node-cron'); cron.schedule('0 2 * * *', () => { backupDatabase(); });
correctness: Cron schedules recurring backup tasks.

question: Build progressive enhancement.
correctness: Progressive enhancement works without JavaScript.

question: Implement picture element for art direction.
correctness: Picture element selects image by viewport.

question: Create performance-optimized HTML.
correctness: Preconnect and lazy loading optimize performance.

question: Build schema.org structured data.
example_answer:
Title

Content
Author
correctness: Schema markup helps search engines understand content.

question: Implement WCAG contrast requirements.
example_answer: color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF; /* Contrast ratio 21:1 */
correctness: High contrast ensures accessibility for all users.

question: Create breadcrumb navigation.
example_answer:
1. Home
  2. Products
  3. Current Page
correctness: Breadcrumb helps users understand page hierarchy.

question: Build skip-to-content link.
example_answer:
Skip to main content
Main content here
correctness: Skip link helps keyboard users navigate faster.

question: Implement required field indicators.
example_answer: <form><label for='email'>Email <abbr title='required'>*</abbr></label><input id='email' type='email' required aria-required='true' /></form>
correctness: Indicators show required fields accessibly.

question: Create responsive table.
example_answer:
Column 1Column 2
Value 1Value 2
correctness: Data attributes enable responsive table styling.
